newsitem.title: UK: Vodafone plans fixed telecom services - FT.
newsitem.headline: Vodafone plans fixed telecom services - FT.

text.p: UK mobile phone company Vodafone Group Plc is set to conclude a deal to offer fixed telecoms services to its customers, the Financial Times reported on Monday.

The report quoted Vodafone chief executive Chris Gent as saying the group was "one month away" from an agreement with Energis, the telecommunications arm of electricity distributor National Grid Group Plc.

Vodafone would offer voice telephony, data communications and private networks and would become the first mobile operator to offer fixed telecoms, the Financial Times said. Its main target would be the corporate market.

The move could pose a threat to British Telecommunications Plc, which dominates the fixed market in the UK. BT, which owns a 60 percent share in the Cellnet mobile company, is increasing the links between its mobile and fixed businesses.
